website_summaries.verdict: With its large catch cage and bug-attracting power that covers up to an acre, this is the top model in the Dynatrap family.
pros: Dynatrap's largest model that offers ample bug-catching space and the ability to attract pests up to 1 acre
The spacious catch cage doesn't require dumping as frequently as smaller traps
cons: Its large build is heavy and a bit bulky, and may be too much for small yards
It's also the most expensive trap the brand has to offer

website_summaries.verdict: One of the best by Dynatrap and worth considering for large areas; however, you can find effective, less pricey models if you don't need to catch insects in a large area.
pros: A sturdy trap that combines UV light and a quiet fan to attract insects up to 1 acre
Has a large insect catching compartment that doesn't require frequent emptying under most conditions
cons: It occasionally catches critters that are beneficial, such as ladybugs, honeybees, and even lizards

customer_reviews.title: Does not catch mosquitoes, even with bait!
customer_reviews.text: Latest update: this product doesn't work. I placed it in a 24x50 partially enclosed shed for 4 weeks and it did not reduce the mosquitoes. I was also using mosquito bait... it still isn't great, but placed directly below our sitting area it might help with mosquitoes. Will update later... Placed it in two places where mosquitoes always were, one was under my deck. I even put mosquito bait in it. In about 6 days I think it caught 15 mosquitoes. The sad part is it caught a ton of moths and other beneficial insects.
customer_reviews.author: Monkey

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This did not seem to catch any mosquitoes, only a ton of moths. I'm not sure how this has so many good reviews but I do not recommend it at all. I have been trying to find a way to get rid of the mosquitoes without spraying an insecticide but this is not the answer. I will look into other options.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: From skeptic to believer!
customer_reviews.text: Catches ALL kinds of flying insects, for better or for worse. Honestly, before we got this, we couldn't even get from the car to the front door without several bites. Now, they are few and far between. There is also a huge difference at the BACK of the house! I am very skeptical about these kinds of things, but we can actually enjoy our front porch now!!!
customer_reviews.author: SuperMom

customer_reviews.title: Got rid of the bugs with no chemicals
customer_reviews.text: We bought two. One for our home and one as a housewarming gift to friends. We purchased the gift after trying ours for a month in the summer. It worked wonderfully. Almost zero bugs on our deck. We could actually sit outside and enjoy the evening hours. I think the entire bug population of Arkansas was living in our back yard before we used this. One negative thing that we found is that it does not take care of as much area that they claim but works well for what we purchased it for. No spraying or chemicals so safe for people and pets just not safe for the bugs.
customer_reviews.author: Cherina

customer_reviews.title: Does catch bugs, but mosquitos?
customer_reviews.text: This unit does a good job at catching lots of bugs. I had several praying mantis figure out that this was a bug magnet and they parked themselves right on top to intercept inbound bugs! Not convinced that this is a great mosquito catcher. I used it last summer in our back yard and still needed to wear "off" when sitting outside. We have lots of moths around that can be a problem with plants and this unit does a great job of catching them. It does catch lots of different flying insects, but questionable if mosquitos are in the mix. I'm considering using some mosquito bait next season to see if that helps.
customer_reviews.author: Mojo Master

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work as advertised- too expensive!!!
customer_reviews.text: For the money I spent about $200 it does not work and I do not recommend it. I bought this big size for 1 Acre area coverage and I ha e only 0.5 acre but wanted to be sure to bd et all mosquitoes. My daughter gets bitten 10 times more than I do and by buying this I hope to reduce it- it had gotten reduced to 7 times and not less! It has been on for a whole month and we followed all the recommendations. It caught lots of moths but not all mosquitoes- we have to apply anti big sparky if we want to sit outside more than 30 min !!! Which defeats the purpose .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really helps!
customer_reviews.text: We were gifted our first Dynatrap. We live in the Maine woods where there are plenty of black flies, mosquitoes, etc. We noticed a big difference! In fact, we liked it so much, that we ordered a second one for our winter home in Florida, where there are a ton of mosquitoes in the early evening. Then, we bought one for our neighbors down the road, in Maine, who complained of loads of mosquitoes in their yard . They LOVE it! Every time I see them, they thank me again! Finally, we picked one up for our friends in Maine who live by a lake. We just gave them theirs. Can't wait for their response. Obviously, we love this product!
customer_reviews.author: betty

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't catch many mosquitos. Light bulbs quit after 2 years new bulbs still not working?
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this unit 2 years ago and ran it all one summer. I caught a lot of things but not many mosquito's. I put it up for the winter. Got it out and cleaned everything put it out for the next summer and ran it most of the summer. I came out one day and the fan was running but the lights were not on. I bought new BRand Name Dyna Trap Bulbs 7w from the manufacturer and installed them. The light still do not work but the fan does. I checked the fuse and rotated the bulbs many times with no luck. Now I have a $200 boat anchor.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Jernigan

customer_reviews.title: Best product on the market for bugs!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Is all I can say 🤩 I live on a lake front property 🏘🌊🌴🦟 with over 3 miles of waterway. I haven't hung this product yet but it has already blown me away by its effectiveness in the first 2hrs of use. I find that the smallest bugs do find their way out through the small slits on the bottom plastic but if you don't plan to hang use a nice sheet of foil at the bottom of unit to collect anything that falls through 😉 I'm so impressed by this unit 👏 Thank you DynaTrap !!!!! 💯💯💯
customer_reviews.author: Adam Jay

customer_reviews.title: If you got mosquitoes get one
customer_reviews.text: If you have a mosquito problem like we did this past summer you need to get one of these although they are very big and heavy but they work very very well I am very pleased with it I would only buy it new we tried buying a used one and it came cracked and broken so we had to send that one back and just buy a brand new one it does have a slight sound to it because it has a fan inside of it but it’s not too loud
customer_reviews.author: Raul

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! I hooked this giant thing up in the back of our yard and the next day it had collected a ton of small moths, flys, and mosquitoes! I was stoked. And had a family party the next evening, no bites! I didn’t hear one person complain about the mosquitos and no one used bug spray. It was fantastic! Hoping to see a big difference in the spring. I did buy some of the attractant, but haven’t used it yet. I may save that for the spring.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi

customer_reviews.title: The product simply does not work. Do not waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: We have had the unit for roughly 2 months and it has been running non-stop for the entire time. We have seen absolutely ZERO difference in the amount of mosquitoes. In fact, sometimes I wonder if the mosquitoes have actually gotten worse. It does a fair job of killing little moths which aren't a problem. But as for as mosquitoes, it simply does not work. Also, buyer beware, it says that it may take up to 6 to 8 weeks to work; yet the window for returning the unit is 4 weeks or 1 month. HHmmm.....not good because we are stuck with an expensive product that isn't worth the electricity it uses to run.
customer_reviews.author: Pete Donchenko

customer_reviews.title: WORKING GREAT.......
customer_reviews.text: After only a few days, it is half full and working great. We put it on a four ft. heavy duty shepard's hook to make it easy to move as needed, but we haven't needed to move it. We followed the directions and are very happy with it. My granddaughter is enjoying her new play set and not having to deal with mosquitos and flies. We leave it on all the time as directed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Accomplished my main goal but fell far short of its coverage claim
customer_reviews.text: Overall I'm happy with my purchase. My family could not enjoy our backyard as mosquitoes were on you instantly regardless of the time of day. After 3 weeks of use they are largely diminished where we usually sit, but 3/4 of the yard still has just as many as ever. This may just be a matter of it not having enough time to work it magic however. Also wish there were a guard to prevent killing all those poor moths and butterflies. I'll be constructing one soon.
customer_reviews.author: furuh

customer_reviews.title: They Work Great!
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these, the smaller one we use at a cabin in the woods and in ten days filled up with mosquitos and a few moths. I couldn't believe how many there were when I finally emptied it. The other we have at home, the larger one, and it ran for about three months. The bottom was filled when I finally emptied it. We had zero mosquito bites this summer which was warmer than usual, and, my wife is a magnet for them. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert E. Bosso

customer_reviews.title: Kills Mosquitoes
customer_reviews.text: This thing really works. I swell up terrible when I get bite and am unable to spend evenings outside. This has controlled the mosquito population in our yard. Our neighbors have a pond and it is controlling their mosquitoes also. Only downside is it kills more than just mosquitoes. We have had less birds in the yard because of it. Since the evenings are now getting cooler we will put it away for the winter.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Will never buy another DynaTrap product
customer_reviews.text: I was always a great fan of the first couple of DynaTrap insect traps that I bought, they worked extremely well, however it seems to be company policy to change the design of the bulb fittings every couple of years and as you need a new bulb every year, you find that you are forced to buy a whole new unit. If you purchase a lot of bulbs when you initially purchase a unit and you unit gets damaged the old bulbs you still have will not fit the new unit that you buy. Be warned.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Anderson

customer_reviews.title: This product works well we decided we didn’t need it
customer_reviews.text: We live in South Florida and we are on the salt water with very few problems with mosquitoes mostly no seeems. We were disappointed with the effectiveness of this product there was some collection but it was minor so we decided to send the product back. During the time we had it and it worked perfectly and there were no defects. We decided against getting products like this.
customer_reviews.author: Florence Nightengale

customer_reviews.title: So far works really well.
customer_reviews.text: Took about a week but we can now enjoy our back yard and front yard. After the first few days there were a noticeable amount of dead bugs in the basket. The instructions warn you about live bugs in the basket when you open it and they are not kidding.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick L

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be Working
customer_reviews.text: The trap has been up three weeks now, and I definitely see a decrease in the amount of mosquitoes at our camp. Normally our camp (in the pines of Maine) is off limits in the month of June due to the overwhelming amount of mosquitoes. You still need some bug spray, but the population is down a good 70-80%. No kidding. I empty the hopper every Saturday and it is almost full!.
customer_reviews.author: The River Hermit

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work at all!
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed! I read many good reviews of this product and we really wanted to reclaim our backyard so we could enjoy the summer. We can't sit on our deck or do any outside activities without getting eaten up by mosquitos. We moved this to 3 different locations and it was completely useless in all 3. We no more than step out the door and immediately get bitten. It was by no means a cheap venture , but would have been worth it if we could use our yard again. I feel like we got taken.
customer_reviews.author: M. Voice

customer_reviews.title: eeeeeffffff yyoouuuuou Mosquitoes!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. Only took a week and a half and I have a couple hundred mosquitoes in there. I live by a semi wooded area and a retention pond. My only gripe is that removing the tray is difficult. I just bought a cheap door handle from home depot and screw it into the bottom so it’s easier to twist. Other than that this thing really works. A lot of moths too but just look at those mosquitoes in the pictures. It’s also early October in CT so the population is decreasing and this is only helping!
customer_reviews.author: Daley

customer_reviews.title: Does it's job well, however it has some vibrations and it's loud!
customer_reviews.text: Has some serious vibrations going on in there somewhere even after I took it apart and put it back together again. Not sure what is going on, but this thing catches moths and mosquitos like nobodies business!!!!!!! HOLY MOLY there are no bugs anywhere around. The vibrations from the fan are loud and obnoxious. Also it's a tad expensive to buy the mosquito attractant and new bulbs every year, but it's worth it in the end with a moth and mosquito free deck!
customer_reviews.author: Jody Stepp

customer_reviews.title: This alone does not do it but a three-prong approach works pretty well.
customer_reviews.text: I had heard that this trap really worked well with flying mosquitoes. I think it works okay but you still have to do lots of other things to actually control the mosquito population. I discovered putting down granules to kill the larvae really helps and then you have to continually spray the yard with something and then the trap HELPS with killing the adult flying mosquitoes. This alone does not do it but a three-prong approach works pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: Phylbert

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: 2 months in and so far very pleased. We have a house on 2 acres and i set this thing up by the back porch where we are always having guests. The instructions are correct when it says to leave it on for a week before you judge it. After a week there were hundreds of bugs in the trap. Trying to see how many mosquitoes it catches was hard because they pretty much get annihilated when they go through the fan and you just see pieces of them on the bottom. It's ran non stop for 2 months now through sun, wind, and heavy rain without a glitch. Very happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Harry J Demmon

customer_reviews.title: Didn't catch a single mosquito
customer_reviews.text: We hung the unit 5 feet above the ground per the instructions about 50 feet away from our outdoor patio. Ran the unit for over a week and saw that it ONLY captured moths. Probably a few hundred of them. DID NOT CATCH A SINGLE MOSQUITO. For reference we live outside of Boston. We took it down and dont use it. Total waste of money. I should have known. Never heard that mosquitos are attracted to light sources. Thought they were attracted to c02... Garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Reduce the Bug Population in Your Area with this device
customer_reviews.text: This product does work. Every week I mow the yard and dump the bug catch. While the catch is not full it has a lot of dead bugs in it. The product was bigger than we were thinking but for a home system it does the job well. There is no zapping, no worrying about it raining as the product is designed to be outdoors rain or shine. I like this product because it is a turn on a forget about it type device. There is no bait to set no propane to fill. We have had it for most of the summer at it has surpassed my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Phenom13

customer_reviews.title: If there is a mosquito around now—it won't be for long
customer_reviews.text: I took the advice of another reviewer—kept DynaTrap on for four days straight! While I did not get a half-full cage like he had in a photo, there was a huge improvement. It rains often throughout June in So Florida wo the infestation is an annual "festival." I am so pleased that this works. The price is very reasonable. If I have to replace the bulbs—fine! I am a happy boy... without mosquitos.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Extremely impressed!!!
customer_reviews.text: I understand why it gets such a high rating. I am extremely impressed!!! It just arrived today and i cant believe the results. Truely amazing!!! I live in virginia and have constant bugs, mosquitoes, etc. It ruins my porches, Dynatrap is eating them up!!! I am exteremly impressed. So worth the money!! The results are amazing to watch!!!
customer_reviews.author: J&O Services

customer_reviews.title: I am able to use my Hot Tub again!!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is AMAZING!!! Plug it in and clear the back yard in no time. I am able to go out side at night and use the hot tub again!!! This things is AMAZING!!! I only have 1/2 an acre but went with the larger one to make sure that it did the job, and it does!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jillian L. Haffner

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for me at all
customer_reviews.text: I live in south florida and my family likes to gather on the back porch. Some days the mosquitos are terrible so I was really wanting this to work. I bought this large Dynatrap that covers way more area than needed, to ensure I was covered. I also bought lure and put it in the bottom. I have had this many months now and have trapped a boat load of little moths but NOT ONE mosquito. I am very disappointed, I feel like this was a big waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to love this, but I don't.
customer_reviews.text: We've had ours running 24/7 for about 2 weeks. It made a small difference at first but now, 2 weeks later, the mosquitos are back at disturbing levels. It mostly just catches moths and some beetles. Returning this and buying a mosquito magnet. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal A.

customer_reviews.title: How long does it take to see a difference in ...
customer_reviews.text: How long does it take to see a difference in the mosquito population? Had mine out over a week and we are still getting bites!!!!! I have moved it 3 times...caught lots of moths but that's not what I bought it for...suggestions before I send it back?
customer_reviews.author: Marcy

customer_reviews.title: Lights no longer work.
customer_reviews.text: The trap seemed to work for one season. It catches a lot of moths where I live and some other bugs. I recommend emptying into a plastic bag to prevent alive bugs from escaping. My bulbs finally failed. I ordered replacement bulbs and they would not work. I did this again thinking I received bad bulbs. Still no luck. I’m lead to believe the trap is broken...even though the fan runs. I’ll reach out to dynatrap to see if they will make this right.
customer_reviews.author: Paul G.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't catch mosquitos
customer_reviews.text: I want my patio back!! I couldn't sit on my back porch without being bitten. So I did some research, and decided on the Dynatrap 2000XL (OK, it was overkill for my yard, but I wanted some horsepower!). I set it up according to instructions, and ran it for a month. It did a superb job of catching moths. But I STILL cannot sit on my patio without being bitten! I went through the entrails, and not one single mosquito among the corpses. Yes, it catches bugs. No, it does not catch the bugs I want gone!
customer_reviews.author: Old Desert Rat

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for lake house
customer_reviews.text: I don’t usually write reviews, but this thing is awesome. We have a lake house on the OK/TX boarder. The back yard lines up with deep woods on one side and the lake on the other. Last spring summer we couldn’t go outside, the amount of insects was overwhelming. Even opening the back door let a flood of insects into the house. We have had the dyna on for about 4 weeks now and it’s been filled up (totally full) twice. The population of insects has dropped drastically and we are cooking out, enjoying happy hour, and even playing cards in the evenings. This is so much safer and more effective than spraying poison every week. Nice product!
customer_reviews.author: adam jamar

customer_reviews.title: Best bug trap EVER!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this bug trap! Seriously life changing for us. Last summer, in order to stay out side and enjoy our pool and backyard, we had to be willing to suffer several mosquito bites and being plagued by tons of flies. Our kids were always covered in bites and so were we. We got this unit a couple weeks ago and we noticed a difference within just a few days. We haven’t had a single mosquito bite and there are almost zero flies anywhere. All of our family has started buying them and we’re about to buy another for my sister-in-law as a house warming gift. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Kaelin A

customer_reviews.title: Still getting bitten at dusk
customer_reviews.text: We own 0.6 acres in a semi-urban area. We have an inground pool and like to eat dinner out on the pool deck. Even after running this for a few weeks, we were still getting bitten a lot around dusk while seated about 30 feet from the trap. It catches a lot of moths unfortunately as well. I think it maybe reduced the number of mosquitos, but there were still many. My parents recommended this since they have found it very helpful in two different locations, but for us it didn't quite live up to the hype.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Jarrell

customer_reviews.title: It’s cool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for our acre yard because of the flies and mosquitoes. This has to run 24/7 for a couple of months to start noticing the difference. More than anything the keeper traps moths which they never bothered us. I wish horseflies will go in there but overall I am a little happier. We have it about 25 feet from where we are outside.
customer_reviews.author: Hribal

customer_reviews.title: Important anti-mosquito safety
customer_reviews.text: Mosquitoes are the "deadliest animal on the planet" based on the diseases they spread. I have given Dynatraps to all my family and many friends. Run 24/7 during the summer, they keep everyone's house and yard free of mosquitoes and other annoying insects. My son, who lives in the city, says his whole neighborhood had been protected by his one-acre Dynatrap!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Bulbs do not last.
customer_reviews.text: bulbs do not last and dynatrap doing nothing about it except telling you to just keep checking which has been going on for months. As expensive as these are that is unacceptable at best, they should at a minimum be allowing you to back order from them which they are not. My advise stick with something like this  much cheaper and seems to be working good so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Zapped without the noise!
customer_reviews.text: Zapped without the noise! I originally bought the one acre unit for my backyard deck and Jacuzzi as I have always been a "mosquito magnet". If there's one around, it'll find me! I let it run for a week and then ventured out one evening to the hot tub and, much to my delight, not one bite. In a few weeks time, I purchased identical units for my son and daughter and they, too, are delighted with the results. They truly are amazingly effective and I would recommend you, for the slight price difference, purchase the one acre unit for total satisfaction. You will not be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: MightyOak

customer_reviews.title: a total waste of money
customer_reviews.text: We live in so Fla next to a farm with an irrigation canal . We have a really bad mosquito problem due to the irrigation canal. The neighbors use a propane gas mosquito trap and they catch mosquitos by the thousands . When I check our Dyna Trap over a three night period there might be 30-40 mosquitos in it! There will be more beetles and moths than mosquitos. Final word on this trap is its useless for mosquitos!
customer_reviews.author: Bob G.

customer_reviews.title: Moth collector
customer_reviews.text: We live in Southern California. Ours has been plugged in for 10 days and we've only caught lots of moths and this morning a poor praying mantis was stuck in the top grid. It says it takes 3 weeks to make an impact with mosquitos but there doesn't seem to be a single mosquito in the bottom. And there are a TON of mosquitos on our property. Anyone else have this problem and then one day it will magically work? I will happily change my review if this thing starts to work. I mean, there's literally a mosquito on the logo. Hoping it would at least kill a few.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Does not catch mosquitoes effectively
customer_reviews.text: It catches flying insects, but does it catch mosquitoes specifically? Yes, a few, but by chance. I don't think it emits enough CO2, if any, to be effective. I have literally left it on overnight in a closed door room with a mosquito to find that it did not trap it. In fact, the mosquito was still flying around the next day. I would not buy it again for the purpose of catching mosquitoes.
customer_reviews.author: James K

customer_reviews.title: then to hear the fan sounding like a running refrigerator
customer_reviews.text: I sat and watch bugs trying to get in where the screen, then fly away. I rather hear bugs pop, then to hear the fan sounding like a running refrigerator. The size of this thing is larger the a small trash can. I believe it's worth $70, not $150...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No gimmick. This thing works.
customer_reviews.text: I have a 3/4 acre lot with a considerable mix of pine trees, grasses, flowers and deciduous trees. It was a wet summer and mosquitoes ruled. Within 24 hours the population was down noticeably. Within 48 hours and there forward, mosquitoes were uncommon. We placed it near the most dense area but most visible spot, keeping it on 24/7. Our two patios are anywhere from 30 to 120 feet from the trap. Even from a distance it worked exceptionally well. Friends validated the clear difference.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: My brother told me about this product and it works great. Have it at my lake house in Livingston, Texas and it attracts bugs like a charm. It is very quiet and really works great. Getting another for the boat house as that's where all the bugs seem to accumulate.
customer_reviews.author: Stargatesj

customer_reviews.title: Worthless for Asian tiger mosquitos
customer_reviews.text: I live in Santa Clarita, CA where the Asian tiger mosquito is problematic. I tried the Dynatrap. Little to no change. I still get bitten like a bad episode of a Walking Dead. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: deaner

customer_reviews.title: Expensive moth catcher
customer_reviews.text: I ran this trap 24/7 for over 3 weeks with no relief from mosquitoes. Placed in 3 locations with no results. Returned for refund. Over the time I had this trap in use it trapped a lot of moths, a few flys etc and 5-8 mosquitoes. Read the reviews on this product before ordering.
customer_reviews.author: Herb Etheridge

customer_reviews.title: Not Completely Sold
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this product. I have used the Misquito Magnet, which requires propane and attractant plus the power cord to operate. It was somewhat effective but too expensive. This promises the same thing without all the fuss. Well, it will reap bugs and some misquito's are in there but it mainly traps other flying insects. Oh, it also seems to work on moths.
customer_reviews.author: RGM

customer_reviews.title: If you are dealing with wasps this may not be for you. Anything else seams to get trapped.
customer_reviews.text: Just amazed in the difference sitting on the porch now! Traps about a 1/2 inch of bugs a night. Better than I expected. I have had it for 2 months now and no issues. Works great in the weather with all these Missouri storms. Easy to clean as well. Don’t be shocked on the price, it’s well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Does work, doesn’t last long
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my mother in law and it worked great only lasts about a year, if that. But did work great for the whole backyard no mosquitos. But they are cheap enough to buy one every year or so since it does work
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I live in IL near the WI border and deal with quite a mosquito issue. I was looking for a poison free solution since I have young kids and would like to avoid chemicals. I read a lot of reviews and thought to give this a try. HORRIBLE. I've had it running 24/7 for nearly two months now and have caught little more than moths and Asian beetles. The second month I even added mosquito attractant with no improvement. This product was not cheap and I expected much more. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Lot of moths
customer_reviews.text: I have had this up in the back yard now for at least 6 weeks and I am not seeing a big difference in the number of mosquitos. Every time I empty it, it is full of moths, a few yellow jackets and thankfully no bees. I am hoping that by putting it out early spring I won’t have to deal with mosquitoes next year.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for bugs.  Not so great for mosquitos
customer_reviews.text: This does a great job at attracting larger flies and moths but has made little to no impact when it comes to mosquitoes. We live in a typical mainstream development in the North East so there is nothing unique about our bug situation. I gave this 3 stars because the quality is good, it blends well with our landscaping and it does attract some bugs. I would have loved to have given it 5 stars but because it doesn’t improve the mosquito situation which is why I bought it; I just can’t.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Like other have said
customer_reviews.text: I was advertised that it will cover an acre. That might well be.. but after a month time.. I'm still getting bitten by can't see me mosquitoes The bug try has very few . mosquitoes.. even though there are 100's if now more in my 1/4 acre lot. Can barley see them flying around.. but you sure get bitten. but after a month I would expect allot more bugs then it has had a few moths and a couple of other bug.. am I missing something to make it work the way they say?
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Cohen

customer_reviews.title: I don't see the difference...
customer_reviews.text: I'm in between a 2-3 star rating for this product. I've had this up since I bought it back in May I've only had it shut off once just to relocate hoping it would work better. Looks like I've caught a few mosquitoes but more moths then anything. I was really hoping for this to work a lot better then it is so I could enjoy the outdoors in the evening.
customer_reviews.author: Kinney433

customer_reviews.title: life span
customer_reviews.text: this unit worked very well. I was extremely happy with it till it died. the fan still works but after the bulbs went out I changed them to find out the ballast went bad. I had the trap for 2 years and had it on for about 18 mo. that's not long enough for $150.00.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Works okay. Requires extensive ongoing maintenance.
customer_reviews.text: It seems to have helped a lot with the smaller bugs. Requires mosquito attractant to work on them. There are to two types of attractant- get the right type for your area. One year in- I noticed the bottom is filled with bugs. Note that this isn’t the trap area, but the area on the fan. You have to use a screwdriver to clean this part. Bad design.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Baker

customer_reviews.title: The best offense to winning the backyard bug war
customer_reviews.text: So you probably heard of giant Asian hornets invading the states. Time to get them before they get you. Buy this giant bug zapper and defend yourself from the invading hordes!!!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: NOISY
customer_reviews.text: It seems that the only differences between this product a zapper trap is that you don't have to tolerate the zapping sound of the bugs being fried .Instead you get the constant loud noise of the cheap fan that is supplied with this product making impossible to mount it near any open window . The second difference is the $150 + price . I have several small fans purchased for less than $15 that are so quite you can't tell if they are on. I would think that for $150+ The manufacture could provide a fan that doesn't sound like a meat grinder. So far it seems to have cleaned up most of the neigborhood moths.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Gatzios

customer_reviews.title: Attack of the mosquitoes.
customer_reviews.text: It is a scam. It only caught moths. Nothing more than a cool light and fan. The "CO2" produced is negligible to mosquitoes. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: coldbum

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work great. We weak before we got this we had may bugs and mosquitoes swarming us. We ran it for a day or two and we can be outside anywhere on our 1 acre property with no bugs day or night.
customer_reviews.author: cynthia baker

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product.
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had this product for about 10 days now. There are about 50 mosquitoes in the trap. I am so glad we bought this product it is well worth the money. We live in the South and it is only March but they are awful here. Our dog will be able to enjoy the yard this year.
customer_reviews.author: Tracie Fristoe

customer_reviews.title: Super Mosquito Trap
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. We had tons of mosquitoes in our yard. I set this up and and it trapped over a quart of bugs in a week. Half of these (by volume) were mosquitoes- and when they dry out they are tiny. Cleanup is easy, just dump them in the garden, rinse with a hose, and put it back together. It has sat out in the rain, no problem. I used it with no supplemental bait- just the light.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Saved our backyard!
customer_reviews.text: This product really allowed us to use our backyard again. I used to dread going in our backyard because Mosquitoes would be biting me within one minute. I didn’t want to grill outside or use the pool. Within three days of continual use of the DynaTrap, there were virtually NO mosquitos in my backyard. I agree with other users that there is some collateral damage, we have caught a few months and even a ladybug, but we have also caught hundreds of mosquitoes and other biting insects.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Miller

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend purchasing this
customer_reviews.text: OMG! I wouldn't want to be without this insect trap. It helps so much that I don't get eaten up by the mosquitos. It catches moths, beetles, mosquitos, and many other flying insects. I would recommend purchasing this. I will buy another one at a later time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: works great Until
customer_reviews.text: This unit works great.. lamps only lasted 3 months and replacements are backordered for months now.. sooo Dyna Trap is a solid product just get one that you can get lamps for.. like the LED unit..
customer_reviews.author: mark Hogue

customer_reviews.title: Caught lots of mothd
customer_reviews.text: We got a lot of moths....not mosquitoes unless their little bodies shrivel up and I can't see them. However it's not been a month yet. I'll report back.
customer_reviews.author: LIVG

customer_reviews.title: It Helps but there are still mosquitoes
customer_reviews.text: Overall I think it helps but does not completely eliminate mosquito, I run it 24/7 and it catches all types of bugs. I have also cleared some brush and eliminated standing water, the combination off all three things has drastically reduced the mosquitos so not sure which did what. You need to have realistic expectations. If you live next to a swamp this thing isn't going to make your yard bug free but it helps
customer_reviews.author: S. Porento

customer_reviews.title: It works!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love it!!!!! No mosquito's!!!!! Can really enjoy my yard!!!!! I have an acre!!!!!!I 3 friends got one too on my recommendation and tbey love theirs too!!!!!!! Gave one to my sis!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Karen Kay Evans

customer_reviews.title: Previous model was better.
customer_reviews.text: Does not work as expected. Per instructions, let run 24/7, 1 week later, mosquitoes are still prevalent, moths have diminished somewhat.
customer_reviews.author: Jim McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Catches mostly moths and very few mosquitoes.
customer_reviews.text: This unit is big, with a large sized "catch" container. The fan is powerful, and the 2 light bulbs are quite bright. It attracts mostly moths though, and we've seen very few mosquitoes caught in it. (And our yard has a LOT of active mosquitoes from our humid climate.) Maybe it will get more of the pests as time goes on.
customer_reviews.author: Annie L.

customer_reviews.title: COMPLETELY DISSAPOINTED
customer_reviews.text: This thing catches ALMOST everything BUT mosquitoes. I am extremely allergic to mosquitoes bites, so I bought the DynaTrap DT2000XL Extra-Large Insect Trap 2 UV Bulbs, 1 Acre, for a small back yard. I wasted my money; it did not perform as advertised. Apart from not luring mosquitoes to its trap, it is impossible to open to clean. DO NOT WASTE TIME AND MONEY ON THIS PRODUCT.
customer_reviews.author: M. Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Ordered black, received brown. Can't hang it as ...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered black, received brown. Can't hang it as manufacturer recommends because the seller didn't repair/replace the broken top cover. Item arrived in original boxing, with absolutely ZERO bubble wrap, padding, etc inside the box. Shoddy, will not purchase again, will not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money if mosquitos is your target
customer_reviews.text: Does not help with mosquitos. Don’t bother spending your money if that’s what your looking to achieve. It says it takes 6 weeks to reduce population but that’s beyond the return policy. Not good business!!!!! Don’t waste your time with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not work for mosquitoes!
customer_reviews.text: All the Moths on my property are gone but this does not work for mosquitoes. I live in South Florida, mosquitoes are bad so I figured try this it has decent reviews. I have had it up for a month now and nothing but moths and the occasional small lizard looking for food. Set up was easy, clean up is even easier. Wish it worked.
customer_reviews.author: steven scadlock

customer_reviews.title: Really Does Help
customer_reviews.text: It has made a difference in the number of mosquitoes we have seen. We use it on our covered patio. We haven't had very many mosquitoes get in the house since we plugged this in. Normally they want in like they own the place. While it doesn't get them all, especially during peak summer season, it sure does help a lot. Not just with mosquitoes either, moths and other flying insects too!
customer_reviews.author: nursegreen

customer_reviews.title: Defective Product!
customer_reviews.text: The day I received Dyna Trap XL it was defective! The nut that is suppose to hold on the fan assembly was in the bottom of the box and the unit was not attached. I called Dyna Trap immediately and was instructed not to return the product and I would would receive a confirmation email with a few days stating a new XL would be delivered. It has now been 16 days and still no email or replacement unit? Poor customer service and follow-up!!!
customer_reviews.author: RobCole

customer_reviews.title: Not Effective Enough for Michael the Caretaker
customer_reviews.text: We have ordered five units of the smaller sizes which were not very effective and this unit which is the largest we have ordered so far is more effective but still we believe that improvements are needed.
customer_reviews.author: Gary W. Breisch on Facebook

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Caught moths, couple mosquitos and a fly. Amazon is returning it for me.
customer_reviews.author: G.G.

customer_reviews.title: Silent
customer_reviews.text: It is basically silent. Easy to clean and does the trick for eliminating flying insects from our patio. So wonderful that I bought one for our sons new home and another one for a friend’s new home. Works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth A. Wilms

customer_reviews.title: Able to sit outside bug bite free!
customer_reviews.text: We could not use our deck next to the woods because we had no many biting insects. Now we enjoy our deck insect free.
customer_reviews.author: LJC

customer_reviews.title: Catches everything but mosquitos
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this 2 months now and it catches everything, BUT MOSQUITOES! I have it 20 feet from my patio door and mosquitos just hang out on my patio and by the door, not to mention the rest of the yard. I’ve placed it in multiple places and heights in the yard, but haven’t noticed any difference anywhere Its placed. It’s suppose to cover an acre, but I’ve seen no reduction of mosquitoes on my 1/3 acre property.
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: inches deep in dead skeeters
customer_reviews.text: panhandle of Florida here, this beast has been taking care of business for almost 2 months now and not to say we can see a difference quite yet but that's probably because we got 30 days of rain in June. There is at this point a fair 3 inches of dead bugs in our skeeter getter. I have faith that it works, may just take longer based on where you live and weather.
customer_reviews.author: Kelley Drummond

customer_reviews.title: Dynatrap works.
customer_reviews.text: Every year, I had a huge moscito problem at my home. I was willing to try anything. I purchased a dynatrap about 4 years ago. It made a big difference. My only problem is the traps bulb finally burned out. That is what brought me here today to find a replacement bulb. PS Once I get power to my farm, I am going to buy more of these units. The farm has drainage district canals going through my property which is a breeding ground for moscitos.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff C.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth your money.
customer_reviews.text: This product worked somewhat when we first bought it. We put new bulbs in it this year and it won't light. It didn't work well enough to get it fixed. Bulbs were $20 though. Stuck with them now.
customer_reviews.author: clattea

customer_reviews.title: This thing is amazing
customer_reviews.text: This allows me to use outdoor space in FL year round. I wish I was getting commission on all of the people that I have convinced to buy one. They are all happy customers too. It does take a few weeks to change the breeding cycle enough to impact the insect population.
customer_reviews.author: monoc3

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Used this all summer and I have to say that it worked like a charm! It kept our patio area clear of pesky flying insects so we could enjoy cookouts with friends and simple relaxing time with coffee/book. Easy to clean and easy to empty throughout the season. Just seeing how many insects were trapped in the bottom attested to it's efficacy.
customer_reviews.author: L. W. Horton

customer_reviews.title: bought new ones seems to be working better now, new bulbs much brighter
customer_reviews.text: Had item 1 week then the bulbs went out, bought new ones seems to be working better now, new bulbs much brighter. Not worth the hassle to return for new bulbs $15.00. We will see how these do. Other than that seems to be working fine now. I will update later.
customer_reviews.author: L. C. BURGE

customer_reviews.title: Probably wouldn't get this again - but it 'might' work??
customer_reviews.text: Probably wouldn't get this again - but it 'might' work?? I am just not convinced it's catching more than moths, which is what everyone said. You could try it if you the cost won't put you in the drink, but really - Probably wouldn't get it again.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Peller

customer_reviews.title: Great product just wish the basket was built with stronger plastic
customer_reviews.text: Works well but the basket is made of cheap flimsy plastic. mine came out of the box with a chip in it but instead of returning it I just put tape over it. It's kind of crazy but in the evenings you'll sit there and just watch this thing suck up all the bugs mostly moths. Overall very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: buy one if you can, that works to see if it really effective for the stated acreage
customer_reviews.text: Plug it in makes sound (fan) no light, next blew fuse twice on different locations, within 1 hour. Try again same results, next trip KHOLS store. waste of time
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: Works fine for moths and other
customer_reviews.text: Certainly does not cover 1 acre. Works fine for moths and other, but much less effective for mosquitos. It stated excellent for mosquito coverage, but did not do the job. Neighbor bought one as well at my recommendation .....and he returned his.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend this product! Keeps the bugs away.
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love it. I live near a lake, and it keeps the bugs way down! Well worth the price. I do advise that you purchase some mosquito attractant and place it in the top to help draw them. But even without the attractant, it does a great job. Just be sure that you place this away from where you and your family and guests will be gathering.
customer_reviews.author: Trudy

customer_reviews.title: Great looking product and well built
customer_reviews.text: Definitely catches bugs. More Moths than anything, but i didn't start using it in prime mosquito season. Interested to see how it does next spring. Very Quiet and well built.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Catches bugs of all sorts. Easy to set up but will need a hook to hang on and electrical nearby. Our neighbors have the same unit so with both working we eliminate most of the bugs but not all mosquitoes. Worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: Angela C.

customer_reviews.title: Still hoping.
customer_reviews.text: The jury is still out, but it doesn't seem to trap many mosquitoes here even with using the southern lure and Terminex mosquito bait and kill.
customer_reviews.author: JSykes

customer_reviews.title: Returned-didn't work
customer_reviews.text: Returned. Just didn't live up to the hype. Caught plenty of bugs and was not selective about it either-moths, beetles, gnats-basically everything. Used as recommended to the letter but the skeeters just kept on coming. There is no way this could control an acre, NO WAY
customer_reviews.author: Jason

product_meta.title: DynaTrap DT2000XL Extra-Large Insect Trap 2 UV Bulbs, 1 Acre, Black
product_meta.description: Style:BlackThe DynaTrap XL Mosquito and Insect Trap is the same trap you’ve come to depend upon with more insect-attracting power and extended coverage. Each trap comes with two UV bulbs that provide a powerful lure to flying insects while the extra-large size is capable of trapping more insects than ever before. The size of the trap isn’t the only extra-large update made as these traps now provide protection for up to 1 acre of your property. The DynaTrap XL Mosquito and Insect Trap was designed to be simple to use. First, a UV fluorescent bulb generates a warm light, attracting insects. Then a second lure, an exclusive Ti02 titanium dioxide-coated surface, produces CO2 that's irresistible to mosquitoes. Third, a powerful yet whisper-quiet vacuum fan sucks insects into the retaining cage where they dehydrate and die.
feature_bullets: 3-way protection against mosquitoes and other flying insects
Extra-large size with 2 UV bulbs designed to catch even more insects
Powerful, whisper-quiet fan traps insects without zapping or buzzing
Extended coverage up to 1 acre; durable all-weather insect trap for use indoors and outdoors; plugs into standard 110-volt outlet

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars1,168 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
